intro: Potentilla murbeckiana, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are palmately divided into five lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Potentilla murbeckiana thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
